pageContext.claim: “We will live by the timeless words of our national motto -- as you know, they wanted to get rid of the word 'God,' right? You wanted to get rid -- 'Let's take the word God out.' They tried it twice! Twice in their Pledge of Allegiance. In fact, the first time I heard it I said, 'Oh, they must've made a typo.' Then I heard it a second time. I said, 'That's not a typo.' They took the word 'God' out, and, uh, they politically had to put it back in, but they'll fight for that.”
pageContext.analysis: Actually, the pledge was recited in full each night of the convention. The words “under God” were omitted at the start of daytime meetings for two caucuses, though.
